subject: Photography
title: Earthrise: The Planet from Space
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Earthrise: The Planet from Space.

hook.text: On Christmas Eve 1968, astronaut Bill Anders looked out and saw Earth rising over the moon. He grabbed his camera.

buildup.text: The Apollo 8 crew was focused on the moon. But the real discovery was looking back at home.

discovery.text: The 'Earthrise' photo showed our planet as a small, fragile marble floating in the black void.

twist.text: The image is credited with launching the environmental movement. Seeing Earth's fragility changed everything.

climax.text: Galen Rowell called it 'the most influential environmental photograph ever taken.'

punchline.text: They went to explore the moon. They discovered Earth.

quiz.question: What movement did the 'Earthrise' photograph help inspire?
